section.title: Known Issues
section.para: This document details known issues with this release and any workarounds that can be applied. Please report any other issues to your &COMPANY_NAME_SHORT; support representative.

tgroup.tbody:
Intel Centrino Advanced + WiMax 6250 is listed as a device to add in &BC;
Issue: On the Panasonic CF-N10 laptop, a WiMax device shows up in the &BC; for assignment as a USB device. It can be safely ignored.
Users with Names Containing Non-ASCII Characters Cannot Connect to &BACKEND; (Japanese and Simplified Chinese versions)
Issue: It is possible to set up a user on the &BACKEND; with double-byte characters in the username, but these cannot be input on the secure authentication screen. This issue is due to a limitation in third-party software used by &BACKEND; which &COMPANY_NAME_SHORT; is actively trying to address.
Workaround: Use only ASCII characters in setting user names with &BACKEND;.
Apparent problem reestablishing a session after interruption when logged in with Synchronizer admin privileges
Issue: If you are using &PB; as an &BACKEND; admin user or as a user allowed to author VM images, and you attempt to change the version of a VM (VM details > Synchronization > Edit > Change version) and the network connectivity during your session was interrupted, the login prompt immediately obscures the "not connected" message which should appear first. When you log in, the earlier message is exposed. This makes it appear as if logging back in did not reestablish a session. The message can be safely dismissed.

step.para: In the Windows VM, click Start > Control Panel > Programs and Features.
